intro: Campylospermum umbricola, commonly known as the shadowy campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dark green, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in shaded environments. Its flowers are small and typically pink or white, arranged in clusters. Campylospermum umbricola is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as undergrowth in rainforests.
